This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=BAALPG.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-09T10:28:39Z Dave Sayers 2015-03-09T10:28:31+00:00 2015-03-09T10:28:31+00:00 TeachLing email list https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAALPG;f178ae43.1503 Hello one and all,<br><br>From time to time, it occurs to me that I really have too much time on my hands. In<br>moments like those, I'm prone to taking on exciting new projects, which may or may<br>not contribute to what I'm actually supposed to be doing. And so with that<br>exhilarating drumroll, I hereby introduce... TEACHLING, a new mailing list for anyone<br>wanting to discuss teaching linguistics. [...] BENNETT Magda 2015-02-11T11:15:28+00:00 2015-02-11T11:15:28+00:00 University of Edinburgh New Directions in Second Language Teaching https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAALPG;31b30eb.1502 The University of Edinburgh is a charitable body, registered in<br>Scotland, with registration number SC005336. Dave Sayers 2015-01-05T16:12:57+00:00 2015-01-05T16:12:57+00:00 Sociolinguistic Events Calendar call for volunteers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAALPG;71ae0bc2.1501 Hello one and all, and happy new year!<br><br>The Sociolinguistic Events Calendar (http://www.baal.org.uk/slxevents.html) is now<br>bustling with events across the world, and has also been linked to by a number of<br>event organisers, including NWAV: http://linguistics.utoronto.ca/nwav44/. Meanwhile<br>the synopsis on academia.edu is apparently in the top 3% of viewed pages this month<br>(http://academia.edu/9619924). My co-calendariser - Jonathan Kasstan - and I are<br>overwhelmingly honoured by all this success, acclaim and esteem, which has helped us<br>keep plugging away at it, but... we are kinda getting a little overworked with it<br>all. Help us! We're looking to recruit volunteers to help [...] I. M. Laversuch Nick 2014-12-22T11:17:20+00:00 2014-12-22T11:17:20+00:00 1st Call for Papers in Forensic Linguistics/Phonetics https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAALPG;1fc0f6de.1412 The Germanic Society for Forensic Linguistics (GSFL) is pleased to announce the first call for papers for the Third Annual Roundtable in Forensic Linguistics. The pupose of the GSFL is to provide researchers, teachers, and practitioners (e.g. psychologists, sociologists, crimonologists, police officers, interpreters/translators, lawyers, etc.) working within forensic linguistics, the opportunity to present and discuss their work within a creative, supportive, interdisciplinary setting. Paper and poster abstracts are invited in any of the following areas: [...] Marilyn Pasqua 2014-12-08T00:31:19+01:00 2014-12-08T00:31:19+01:00 CfPs Deadline extended- Language: Education, Society and Profession-AEQ https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAALPG;54c24432.1412 CALL FOR PAPERS:<br><br>ACADEMIC EXCHANGE QUARTERLY (ISSN 1096-1453)<br><br>SPRING 2015, VOLUME 19, ISSUE 1<br>LANGUAGE: EDUCATION, SOCIETY AND<br>PROFESSION<br>DEADLINE EXTENDED UNTIL 3RD JANUARY 2015<br><br>Keyword:<br>LANGUAGE-2015<br>Link: http://rapidintellect.com/AEQweb/language.htm [1]<br><br>Feature Editors:<br>Emilia Di Martino<br>Universit\ufffd\ufffd Suor Orsola Benincasa,<br>Napoli (Italia)<br>E-mail: emiliadimartino@gmail.com<br>&<br>Marilyn Pasqua<br><br>University of Calabria, Italy<br>E-mail: marilynpasqua@tiscali.it<br>&<br>Anna<br>Franca Plastina<br>University of Calabria, Italy<br>E-mail:<br>annafranca.plastina@unical.it<br>&<br>Bruna Di Sabato<br>Universit\ufffd\ufffd Suor<br>Orsola Benincasa, Napoli (Italia)<br>E-mail: bdisabato.unisob@gmail.com<br>[2]<br><br>EVERY PUBLISHED ARTICLE AUTOMATICALLY QUALIFIES FOR INCLUSION IN<br>THE UPCOMING SOUND<br>INSTRUCTION BOOK LANGUAGE: EDUCATION, SOCIETY AND<br>PROFESSION [...] Mal Williamson 2014-11-27T11:58:30+00:00 2014-11-27T11:58:30+00:00 Re: Neurocreator - new journal https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAALPG;67f7b328.1411 Hello Martin - Babel is excellent.<br><br>I hope we can match your production as we go forward - without directly<br>copying it! Which is very tempting because you have produced a great online<br>version of an academic journal. I think we intend to feature practising<br>artists with more interviews etc so yes...maybe we are a magazine. But as<br>in the other email to BAALPG we have a different and real purpose in<br>engaging the wider academic community. [...] Mal Williamson 2014-11-27T11:41:52+00:00 2014-11-27T11:41:52+00:00 Re: Neurocreator - new journal https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAALPG;272b0189.1411 Many thanks Dave,<br><br>point taken and fully accepted. We are indeed reviewing the peer process<br>along more academic lines although we will still not approach proper<br>academic standards. In the next edition we will make that clearer.<br><br>We are aiming to discover whether there is a field of study here? Does<br>neuro-linguistics/neuroscience - or allow me to write<br>"neuro-linguistics/neuroscience" - have anything particular to offer for<br>creators or for studies of what others insit is something called<br>"creativity"? Or is this best left to proper neuroscience research? If so -<br>what is left to help creators, creative industries and educators [...] Martin Edwardes 2014-11-27T11:07:21-00:00 2014-11-27T11:07:21-00:00 Re: Neurocreator - new journal https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAALPG;154ba08.1411 This is an interesting one, I don't know how it got out to the BAALMail group. It seems to be using a different email address - BAALPG@JISCMAIL.AC.UK instead of our usual baalmail-bounces@lists.leeds.ac.uk.<br><br>Having said that, I don't think we need to evaluate this publication against academic journals. Although it describes itself as a journal, I don't think the term is used with the academic meaning. The publication is clearly a magazine, probably part of the Creator College project, itself a part of the East Riding College; and it seems to be aimed at a similar audience as Babel magazine, although [...] Dave Sayers 2014-11-27T08:08:24+00:00 2014-11-27T08:08:24+00:00 Re: Neurocreator - new journal https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAALPG;c5d83aff.1411 I have nothing specific to say about this journal (my solicitor assures me, ahem),<br>but *in general terms* I would advise all readers to be very, very wary of new<br>journals with no clear peer review process, conspicuously broad thematic scope, and<br>charges for things like subscriptions and submissions. To sharpen up your discernment<br>of such matters, have a read through http://scholarlyoa.com/. [...] Mal Williamson 2014-11-26T11:39:00+00:00 2014-11-26T11:39:00+00:00 Neurocreator - new journal https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAALPG;9dd01100.1411 *apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Hello Creators,<br><br>the inaugural journal of Neurocreator introduces a different way of looking<br>at how creators do what we do.<br><br>From the traditions of general semantics, neuro-linguistics, changework<br>therapies and the latest explorations of neuroscience comes an approach<br>that is already transforming creators' lives.<br><br>For instance, the concepts of inspiration and the muse are based on very<br>old ideas - such as the belief system of the Roman Empire and their gods!<br>Surely in the 21st Century we can get closer to the reality of the creative<br>process? Allen Police Jargon: More than Words Can Say?<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Dr. S. Blackwell Language in the Service of Lawfare: The \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdWorking Definition of Anti-semitism\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd of the European Monitoring Centre on Racism and Xenophobia (EUMC) [...] revista maestria 2014-08-08T10:37:51-07:00 2014-08-08T10:37:51-07:00 Colombian Applied Linguistics Journal Call for papers Volumes 17 and 18 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAALPG;3b2dbb73.1408 Call for papers Volume 17 Number 2, and Volume 18 Numbers 1 and 2 \ufffd\ufffd The Colombian Applied Linguistics Journal, CALJ, is a peer-reviewed publication published by Universidad Distrital Francisco Jos\ufffd\ufffd de Caldas, in Bogot\ufffd\ufffd, Colombia. It is mainly concerned with disseminating completed and outgoing research, pedagogical innovations and theoretical reviews relevant to the field of applied linguistics and language education. CALJ is intended to inform the local, national and international community of educators interested in research on English as a foreign language education and on second/foreign language acquisition. The journal follows three main research lines: language teachers\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd education and [...] Vassiliki Markaki 2014-04-30T19:05:03+00:00 2014-04-30T19:05:03+00:00 Interactional Competences in Institutional Practices: Deadline for abstract submission extended https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAALPG;d11faf12.1404 The abstract submission deadline for the International conference ICIP14 (Interactional Competences in Institutional Practices) has been extended to Thursday, 15 May 2014.<br><br>Individual papers and posters must be submitted to : https://www2.unine.ch/ic-you/icip2014<br><br>KEYNOTE SPEAKERS<br>Janet Holmes (Victoria University of Wellington)<br>Timothy Koschmann (Southern Illinois University School of Medicine)<br>Hanh Thi Nguyen (Hawaii Pacific University)<br>Richard Young (University of Wisconsin-Madison) [...]
